page.title: 15PORT OF MENTEITH FISHING
page.content: In order to keep the lake stocked 8 ponds have been made to breed the trout.The fry are bought in and fed on high protein pellets. As they grow they are selected and separated into different ponds according to their size until they are big enough to be put into the lake.Over 1000 fish in excess of 2 pounds are put into the lake every week during the fishing season. The brown trout is native to this country but the most popular type today is the rainbow trout which has been introduced from America and New Zealand. We watched some trout being moved from the breeding ponds to the floating cages in the lake.These cages are designed to protect the trout from predators such as pike or herons until they are big enough to be released into the lake.
